title: /eth/v1/beacon/states/head/committees returns incorrect information
body:
### Describe the bug

Calling `/eth/v1/beacon/states/head/committees` on the API endpoint always returns committees for slot 0, for example on the current deneb testnet:

```
curl -s 'https://xxx@bn.lodestar-ethereumjs-1.srv.4844-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io/eth/v1/beacon/states/head/committees'| jq -r .data[].slot | sort | uniq -c
     32 0
```

### Expected behavior

Would expect to see the committees for the current epoch, for example:

```
curl -s 'https://xxx@bn.teku-nethermind-1.srv.4844-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io/eth/v1/beacon/states/head/committees'| jq -r .data[].slot | sort | uniq -c
      1 38176
      1 38177
      1 38178
      1 38179
      1 38180
      1 38181
      1 38182
      1 38183
      1 38184
      1 38185
      1 38186

      1 38203

      1 38205
      1 38206

```

### Steps to reproduce

As per above, connected to pre-devnet 6

### Additional context

_No response_
